top_categories.workout_context: Dirty Pecan’s fl countryside, flat gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Dirty Pecan isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Dirty Pecan rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Dirty Pecan’s fl flat gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Dirty Pecan’s fl flat gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty Pecan. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Dirty Pecan — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Dirty Pecan when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Dirty Pecan — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on fl flat gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Dirty Pecan — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Dirty Pecan’s fl flat gravel delivers on race day.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Dirty Pecan count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Dirty Pecan’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty Pecan requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on fl flat gravel to build confidence. Expect: fl countryside, flat gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 65 miles of fl flat gravel in Florida.
